Get a user's social connections

Source: R/trakt-user-network.R
trakt.user.network.Rd

Retrieve a user's followers, followings or friends (the two-way relationship).

trakt.user.network(relationship = c("friends", "followers", "following"),
  user = getOption("trakt_username"), extended = c("min", "full"))

Arguments

relationship

character(1) ["friends"]: Type of user relationship. Either "friends", "followers", or "following".
user

Target username. Defaults to getOption("trakt_username"). Can also be of length greater than 1, in which case the function is called on all user values separately and the result is combined.
extended

character(1): Either "min" (API default) or "full". The latter returns more variables and should generally only be used if required.

Value

A tibble().

Details

The corresponding API methods are described in the API reference.

The relevant endpoints for this function are, depending on relationship:

  • followers: users/:id/followers

  • following: users/:id/following

  • friends: users/:id/friends

Note

Since no OAuth2 methods are supported yet, the specified user must not be private.

See also

Other user data: trakt.user.collection, trakt.user.history, trakt.user.ratings, trakt.user.stats, trakt.user.watched, trakt.user.watchlist

Examples

# \dontrun{
trakt.user.network("friends", "jemus42")
#> # A tibble: 21 x 7
#>    friends_at          username       private name    vip   vip_ep slug         
#>    <dttm>              <chr>          <lgl>   <chr>   <lgl> <lgl>  <chr>
